p:
There can also be different types or ‘flavors’ of ENSO: the eastern Pacific type, in which SST anomalies are centered in the east, and the central Pacific type, in which SST anomalies occur near the International Date Line
8, 32 . Because their underlying dynamics may be different
33, 34 , these events may respond differently to climate change
35 . CMIP5 ensemble projections show either an increase or no significant change in central Pacific ENSO amplitude, depending on methodology. Some assessments of CMIP5 subsets project increased central Pacific ENSO frequency or amplitude
20, 35 , while others indicate no robust changes
36, 37 . Analyses of the overall CMIP5 ensemble show no significant change in central Pacific ENSO indices
20, 36 .
